text: <@U22PKFRU5> I’ve been using this resource for _years_. It’s mostly about _git_ and not git_hub_, but still useful for learning the commands. It’s got a sandbox mode that is super helpful for modeling complex branch structures and lets you kinda dry run through them visually
anybody do an umbraco to HubSpot migration?
Is there no way to create a search results template from a clone of another template?

it seems there is not but this neat little extension helped a ton with copy/pasting modules
<http://neambo.com/hubx>
you can only clone drag n drop templates to be the same template type as the original. It’s something that’s been discussed before.
My bad..i was not aware and i couldn't find anything in search that was specific to my question
It’s definitely something that would make life easier if they allowed us to convert template types. The reason they don’t I think is because some template types support modules others don’t.
I remember this before it was released.. seems cool
Can you embed a "communications preferences" module on a page that isn't a system page?
i.e. on a blog post i'd like to have a check list of newsletters our readers can subscribe to

If you mean a manage preferences link like in a email, then my understanding is no. Last I talked with HubSpot, it was only possible through an email since they can be sure the person changing their preferences is  that email (unless of course they forward the email)
Trying to achieve something similar to this in a sidebar.
You could set up a form for it. Depending on which checkbox they select, it would add them to a workflow that enrolls them in those communications preferences. Just a thought.
That's an interesting idea, I like it...
